Sentencas: This study characterizes BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-delta (BCFN) perovskite oxide and evaluates it as a potential cathode material for proton-conducting SOFCs with a BaZr0.2Ce0.7Y0.2O3-delta (BZCY) electrolyte.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A four-probe DC conductivity measurement demonstrated that BCFN has a modest electrical conductivity of 2-15 5 cm(-1) in air with p-type semiconducting behavior.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An electrical conductivity relaxation test showed that BCFN has higher D-chem and K-chem than the well-known Ba0.5Sr0.5CO0.8Fe0.2O3-delta oxide.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, it has relatively low thermal expansion coefficients (TECs) with values of 18.2 x 10(-6) K-1 and 14.4 x 10(-6) K-1 at temperature ranges of 30-900 degrees C and 30-500 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The phase reaction between BCFN and BZCY was investigated using powder and pellet reactions.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: EDX and XRD characterizations demonstrated that BCFN had lower reactivity with the BZCY electrolyte than strontium-containing perovskite oxides such as SrCo0.9Nb0.1O3-delta and Ba0.6Sr0.4Co0.9Nb0.2O3-delta.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The impedance of BCFN was oxygen partial pressure dependent.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Introducing water into the cathode atmosphere reduced the size of both the high-frequency and low-frequency arcs of the impedance spectra due to facilitated proton hopping.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The cathode polarization resistance and overpotential at a current density of 100 mA cm(-2) were 0.850 Omega cm(-2) and 110 mV in dry air, which decreased to 0.43 Omega cm(-2) and 52 mV, respectively, in wet air (similar to 3% H2O) at 650 degrees C. A decrease in impedance was also observed with polarization time; this was possibly caused by polarization-induced microstructure optimization.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A promising peak power density of similar to 585 mW cm(-2) was demonstrated by an anode-supported cell with a BCFN cathode at 700 degrees C. Copyright (C) 2011, Hydrogen Energy Publications, LLC.
Titulo: Characterization and evaluation of BaCo0.7Fe0.2Nb0.1O3-δ as a cathode for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells
